hero.title: Dengue Fever Diagnostic

features.comprehensiveDesc: Detailed questionnaire covering all dengue fever symptoms and warning signs.
features.forwardChainingDesc: Progressive reasoning through symptom patterns to reach accurate conclusions.
features.quickResultsDesc: Receive instant diagnostic results with actionable medical recommendations.
features.privacyFirstDesc: Your health data is stored securely and privately on your device.
features.trackHistoryDesc: Monitor your test history and track symptoms over time.

disclaimer.title: Medical Disclaimer

Always seek the advice of qualified health providers with any questions regarding a medical condition. In case of emergency or severe symptoms, seek immediate medical attention.

certaintyFactor.title: Certainty Factor
certaintyFactor.indicates: A certainty factor of {{cf}} indicates {{level}} probability of dengue fever based on your symptoms.

confidenceLevel.title: Confidence Level
confidenceLevel.based: This assessment is based on {{count}} answered questions using the certainty factor methodology.

recommendations.title: Medical Recommendations
recommendations.description: Next steps based on your assessment
recommendations.urgentDesc: Your symptoms indicate a potentially serious condition. Please seek immediate medical attention at the nearest emergency department or call emergency services.
recommendations.consultationDesc: Schedule an appointment with a healthcare provider soon. Your symptoms warrant professional medical evaluation and possibly laboratory testing.
recommendations.lowRiskDesc: Your symptoms suggest low probability of dengue fever. Continue monitoring your health and consult a healthcare provider if symptoms worsen or new symptoms appear.
recommendations.advice1: Stay hydrated - drink plenty of fluids
recommendations.advice2: Get adequate rest and avoid strenuous activities
recommendations.advice3: Monitor your temperature and symptoms regularly
recommendations.advice4: Avoid mosquito exposure using repellents and protective clothing
recommendations.advice5: Do not self-medicate with aspirin or NSAIDs - consult a doctor

dialog.deleteOneDesc: This will permanently delete this test result. This action cannot be undone.
dialog.deleteAllDesc: This will permanently delete all your test history. This action cannot be undone.

diagnosis.severeTitle: Severe Dengue - Immediate Medical Attention Required
diagnosis.severeRec: Seek emergency medical care immediately. You show strong indicators of severe dengue fever with potentially life-threatening complications.
diagnosis.highRec: Consult a healthcare provider urgently. You display significant symptoms consistent with dengue fever. Early medical intervention is crucial.
diagnosis.moderateRec: Schedule a medical consultation. Your symptoms suggest possible dengue infection. Laboratory tests are recommended for confirmation.
diagnosis.lowRec: Monitor your symptoms. While dengue is less likely, continue observing your health and consult a doctor if symptoms worsen.
diagnosis.minimalRec: Dengue fever is unlikely based on your symptoms. However, if you have health concerns, consider consulting a healthcare provider.
diagnosis.noneRec: Your symptoms do not suggest dengue fever. If you have other health concerns, please consult a healthcare professional.

q1.question: Are you experiencing sudden high fever (above 38.5°C or 101.3°F)?
q1.description: Dengue typically begins with a sudden onset of high fever that can last 2-7 days.

q2.question: Do you have a severe headache?
q2.description: Intense headaches, particularly in the frontal region, are common in dengue fever.

q3.question: Are you experiencing pain behind the eyes (retro-orbital pain)?
q3.description: Pain behind or around the eyes, especially when moving them, is a characteristic symptom of dengue.

q4.question: Are you experiencing severe joint and bone pain?
q4.description: Dengue is sometimes called "breakbone fever" due to severe joint and bone pain.

q5.question: Do you have severe muscle pain (myalgia)?
q5.description: Widespread muscle pain and body aches are typical in dengue infection.

q6.question: Have you developed a skin rash?
q6.description: A maculopapular rash may appear 2-5 days after fever onset, typically on the trunk and spreading to limbs.

q7.question: Are you experiencing nausea or vomiting?
q7.description: Gastrointestinal symptoms like nausea and vomiting are common in dengue.

q8.question: Are you experiencing extreme fatigue or weakness?
q8.description: Profound fatigue and weakness can persist even after other symptoms improve.

q9.question: Have you experienced loss of appetite?
q9.description: Reduced appetite is common during dengue infection.

q10.question: Are you experiencing abdominal pain or tenderness?
q10.description: Severe or persistent abdominal pain can be a warning sign of severe dengue.

q11.question: Do you have persistent vomiting (unable to keep fluids down)?
q11.description: Persistent vomiting is a warning sign that may indicate progression to severe dengue.

q12.question: Have you noticed any unusual bleeding (nose, gums, bruising)?
q12.description: Minor bleeding manifestations like nosebleeds, gum bleeding, or easy bruising can occur.

q13.question: Are you experiencing difficulty breathing or rapid breathing?
q13.description: Respiratory distress can indicate severe dengue requiring immediate medical attention.

q14.question: Do you have bleeding gums or blood in saliva?
q14.description: Bleeding from gums is a common manifestation of dengue hemorrhagic complications.

q15.question: Are you experiencing restlessness, irritability, or altered mental state?
q15.description: Changes in mental status or consciousness can indicate severe complications.

about.title: About DengueExpert
about.subtitle: A Rule-Based Reasoning expert system designed to assist in preliminary dengue fever diagnosis using forward chaining methodology and evidence-based medical knowledge.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.content: To provide accessible, reliable, and efficient preliminary dengue fever screening through expert system technology, helping individuals make informed decisions about seeking medical care.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.content: To become a trusted tool in early dengue detection and prevention, contributing to better health outcomes and reducing the burden of dengue fever in communities.

ruleBased.title: Rule-Based Diagnosis
ruleBased.desc: Expert medical rules systematically analyze symptoms to reach accurate conclusions.

forwardChaining.title: Forward Chaining Logic
forwardChaining.desc: Progressive reasoning method that follows symptom patterns to determine diagnosis.

evidenceBased.title: Evidence-Based Medicine
evidenceBased.desc: Built on established medical guidelines and clinical evidence for dengue diagnosis.

efficient.title: Fast & Efficient
efficient.desc: Quick assessment process that delivers results in under 5 minutes.

team.title: Our Team

commitment.title: Our Commitment

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: We are committed to protecting your privacy and ensuring the security of your personal information.

intro.title: Introduction
intro.content: This Privacy Policy explains how DengueExpert collects, uses, and protects your personal information when you use our diagnostic system. By using our services, you agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with this policy.

dataCollection.title: Information We Collect
dataCollection.content:
We collect information that you provide directly to us, including:

• Personal Information: Name, email address, and phone number when you register
• Health Information: Symptoms and test results you input for diagnosis
• Usage Data: Information about how you interact with our service
• Device Information: IP address, browser type, and operating system

All health data is stored locally in your browser and is never transmitted to our servers without your explicit consent.

dataUsage.title: How We Use Your Information
dataUsage.content:
We use the collected information for the following purposes:

• To provide and maintain our diagnostic service
• To process your symptom assessments and generate diagnoses
• To improve and personalize your experience
• To communicate with you about updates and important information
• To monitor and analyze usage patterns to improve our service
• To comply with legal obligations and protect our rights

We will never sell your personal information to third parties.

dataSecurity.title: Data Security
dataSecurity.content:
We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal information:

• Encryption of data in transit using SSL/TLS
• Secure authentication mechanisms
• Regular security audits and updates
• Access controls and monitoring
• Local storage of sensitive health data

However, no method of transmission over the Internet is 100% secure. While we strive to protect your information, we cannot guarantee absolute security.

dataSharing.title: Information Sharing
dataSharing.content:
We do not share your personal information with third parties except in the following circumstances:

• With your explicit consent
• To comply with legal obligations or court orders
• To protect our rights, privacy, safety, or property
• In connection with a merger, acquisition, or sale of assets

We may share anonymized and aggregated data for research and statistical purposes.

userRights.title: Your Rights
userRights.content:
You have the following rights regarding your personal information:

• Access: Request a copy of your personal data
• Correction: Request correction of inaccurate information
• Deletion: Request deletion of your personal data
• Export: Download your data in a portable format
• Opt-out: Unsubscribe from marketing communications

To exercise these rights, please contact us using the information provided below.

cookies.title: Cookies and Tracking
cookies.content:
We use cookies and similar tracking technologies to:

• Remember your preferences and settings
• Maintain your login session
• Analyze site traffic and usage patterns
• Improve site performance

You can control cookies through your browser settings. However, disabling cookies may affect the functionality of our service.

contact.title: Questions About Privacy?
contact.description: If you have any questions or concerns about our Privacy Policy or how we handle your data, please don't hesitate to contact us.

cookies.title: Cookie Policy
cookies.subtitle: Learn how we use cookies to keep your experience secure and personalized.

intro.title: Overview
intro.content: This Cookie Policy explains what cookies are, how we use them, and the choices you have. By using DengueExpert, you consent to our use of cookies as described here.

essential.title: Essential Cookies
essential.content:
These cookies are necessary for the site to function and cannot be switched off.

• Authentication and session management
• Security and fraud prevention
• Load balancing and performance

preferences.title: Preference Cookies
preferences.content:
These cookies remember your choices to improve your experience.

• Language preferences
• UI settings and layout choices
• Saved filters and views

analytics.title: Analytics Cookies
analytics.content:
These cookies help us understand how the site is used so we can improve it.

• Page views and navigation flows
• Feature usage trends
• Aggregate performance metrics

functionality.title: Functionality Cookies
functionality.content:
These cookies enable enhanced features and personalization.

• Remembering recent activity
• Maintaining form progress
• Improving accessibility features

thirdParty.title: Third-Party Cookies
thirdParty.content:
Some features may rely on third-party services that set their own cookies.

• Embedded content or widgets
• Analytics or monitoring tools
• External integrations

manage.title: Managing Your Cookies
manage.content:
You can control and delete cookies through your browser settings.

• Block or delete cookies at any time
• Configure per-site preferences
• Note: disabling cookies may affect functionality

contact.title: Questions About Cookies?
contact.description: If you have any questions about our Cookie Policy or how we use cookies, please contact us.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.subtitle: Please read these terms carefully before using DengueExpert diagnostic system.

intro.title: Agreement to Terms
intro.content: By accessing and using DengueExpert, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service and all applicable laws and regulations. If you do not agree with any of these terms, you are prohibited from using this service.

acceptance.title: Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.content:
These Terms of Service constitute a legally binding agreement between you and DengueExpert. By creating an account or using our services, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by these terms.

If you are using our services on behalf of an organization, you represent that you have the authority to bind that organization to these terms.

serviceDescription.title: Service Description
serviceDescription.content:
DengueExpert is a rule-based expert system designed to assist in the preliminary assessment of dengue fever symptoms. Our service:

• Provides symptom-based diagnostic suggestions
• Uses forward chaining methodology
• Stores test history locally in your browser
• Offers educational information about dengue fever

The service is provided "as is" and "as available" without any warranties of any kind.

userResponsibilities.title: User Responsibilities
userResponsibilities.content:
As a user of DengueExpert, you agree to:

• Provide accurate and truthful information
• Use the service only for lawful purposes
• Not attempt to gain unauthorized access to our systems
• Not use the service to harm, harass, or impersonate others
• Keep your account credentials secure
• Not reverse engineer or copy our proprietary algorithms
• Accept sole responsibility for decisions made based on our diagnostic suggestions

medicalDisclaimer.title: Medical Disclaimer
medicalDisclaimer.content:
IMPORTANT: DengueExpert is NOT a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment.

• Our system provides preliminary assessments only
• Always seek the advice of qualified healthcare providers
• Never disregard professional medical advice based on our suggestions
• In case of emergency, contact emergency services immediately
• We are not liable for any medical decisions made based on our service

This tool is designed to assist, not replace, professional medical consultation.

intellectualProperty.title: Intellectual Property Rights
intellectualProperty.content:
All content, features, and functionality of DengueExpert are owned by us and are protected by intellectual property laws:

• Source code, algorithms, and diagnostic rules
• Design, graphics, and user interface
• Text, images, and other content
• Trademarks and branding

You may not copy, modify, distribute, or create derivative works without our express written permission.

limitation.title: Limitation of Liability
limitation.content:
To the maximum extent permitted by law, DengueExpert shall not be liable for:

• Any indirect, incidental, or consequential damages
• Loss of profits, data, or business opportunities
• Medical complications or health issues
• Damages resulting from use or inability to use our service
• Errors or inaccuracies in diagnostic suggestions

Our total liability shall not exceed the amount you paid for using our service (if any).

termination.title: Account Termination
termination.content:
We reserve the right to terminate or suspend your account at any time, without prior notice, for:

• Violation of these Terms of Service
• Fraudulent or illegal activities
• Abuse of our service or other users
• Extended periods of inactivity

Upon termination, your right to use the service will immediately cease. You may also delete your account at any time through your account settings.

changes.title: Changes to Terms
changes.content:
We reserve the right to modify these Terms of Service at any time. Changes will be effective immediately upon posting to our website.

• We will notify users of significant changes via email
• Continued use after changes constitutes acceptance
• It is your responsibility to review these terms periodically

The "Last Updated" date at the top of this page indicates when these terms were last revised.

contact.title: Questions About Terms?
contact.description: If you have any questions or concerns about these Terms of Service, please contact us and we'll be happy to help.
